item.title: Introduction to Findings
item.description: Findings are the main way that DefectDojo standardizes and guides the reporting and remediation process of your security tools. Regardless of whether a vulnerability was reported in SonarQube, Acunetix, or your teamâ€™s custom tool, Findings give you the ability to manage each vulnerability in the same way.

item.title: Creating Findings Manually
item.description: Normally, most of the Findings in your environment will be imported from other security tools. If you wish, you can add manual Finding entries as well, if you have vulnerabilities or work you wish to manage that was not created from a scan tool.

item.title: Editing Findings
item.description: If you want to add notes or update the language on a Finding to be more relevant to the current situation, you can do so through the Edit Finding form.

item.title: Finding Status Definitions
item.description: Each Finding created in DefectDojo has a Status which communicates relevant information. Statuses help your team keep track of their progress in resolving issues.

item.title: Risk Acceptances
item.description: Risk Acceptances are a special status that can be applied to Findings to formally document and operationalize the decision to acknowledge them without immediately remediating them.

item.title: Risk Acceptances
item.description: Risk Acceptances are a special status that can be applied to Findings using either Full Risk Acceptance objects or the Simple Risk Acceptance workflow. Risk Acceptances are used to formally document and operationalize the decision to acknowledge a vulnerable Finding without immediately remediating it.
